title: Public Health And Vaccine Research
description_9:
POSTDOCTORAL FELLOW POSITION IN PUBLIC HEALTH AND VACCINE RESEARCH

Faculty: Medicine and Dentistry
Department: Medicine
Division: Preventive Medicine
Position Title: Post-Doctoral Fellow
Position summary:
Applications are invited for a postdoctoral fellow position within the Division of Preventive Medicine at the
Faculty of Medicine and Dentistry at the University of Alberta. Located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, the
Faculty has been recognized as one of Canadaâ€™s premier health-education institutions.

The successful candidate should have an expertise in applied public health and vaccinology as well as
skills or strong interest in mathematical modeling to work on the project to evaluate public health
interventions to control pertussis using agent-based modeling. This multi-provincial project is funded by
the Canadian Institute of Health Research (CIHR) and Public Health Agency of Canada (PHAC) through
Canadian Immunization Research Network (CIRN). The project is led by Dr. Alexander Doroshenko
(postdoctoral fellow supervisor) at the University of Alberta, Prof. Nathaniel Osgood at the University of
Saskatchewan and Prof. David Fisman at the University of Toronto. The group recently developed a
comprehensive agent-based model on pertussis transmission incorporating natural history of disease and
transmission patterns and created a stylized quasi-static network to depict contact rates and connection
ranges between agents in a typical public health jurisdiction. This project will expand this recently
developed model of pertussis to simulate effects of various public health interventions to control pertussis
and to determine effectiveness of such interventions. The successful candidate will initiate and lead
activities listed below and will consult with project leads as appropriate.
Duties will include

â€¢ Plan research activities and determine the appropriate research methodology
â€¢ Work with graduate student(s) in computer science and project leads to develop and test agent-

based mathematical models using AnyLogic software. Over time a candidate will be expected to
run experiments using developed models

â€¢ Identify and synthesize appropriate empirical data to be used in model parameterization,
calibration and validation

â€¢ Work with a statistician to determine appropriate statistical tests and carry out statistical analyses
using empirical data and data generated by the model

â€¢ Prepare ethics applications as required
â€¢ Conduct literature searches and summarize and present scientific evidence
â€¢ Prepare peer-reviewed scientific manuscripts for publication
â€¢ Develop presentations and reports based on research results
â€¢ Consult with faculty supervisors, project collaborators, public health stakeholders and students
â€¢ Organize research meetings
Preferred qualifications include

â€¢ The successful candidate will have or will soon receive a doctoral degree (or equivalent) in public
health, quantitative methods, epidemiology, mathematical modeling or related discipline.
Applicants with a medical degree and research experience may also apply

â€¢ Knowledge of vaccine-preventable diseases, specifically pertussis

â€¢ Understanding of immunization programs and policies in Canada
â€¢ Skills in using AnyLogic modeling software or strong interest to acquire such skills
â€¢ Experience using statistical software
â€¢ Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
â€¢ Good organizational and team building skills

This full-time position, contingent on satisfactory performance, is available for a period of 24 months, with
the possibility of renewal (subject to securing funding). Annual salary is commensurate with qualifications
and experience. Benefits information for this position can be found at the following link
http://www.postdoc.ualberta.ca/healthcoverage.aspx. Additional funding may be available for attendance
of relevant scientific meetings/conferences. There will be an opportunity for 4-6 months secondment to
the University of Toronto to work with Prof. Fisman. Some travel between research sites may be required.
To apply
Interested applicant can enquire about this position and submit an electronic application consisting of a
cover letter, curriculum vitae and contact information for two referees to
Dr. Alexander Doroshenko, MD MPH FFPH FRCPC
Division of Preventive Medicine
Department of Medicine, University of Alberta
5-30 University Terrace, 8303-112 Street NW
Edmonton, AB T6G2T4
E-mail: adoroshe@ualberta.ca
Tel: 780-492-4910 (+1 if outside of Canada)
Closing date
The position will remain open until filled.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview
will be contacted.
The University of Alberta offers appointments on the basis of merit. We are committed to the principle of
equity in employment. We welcome diversity and encourage applications from all qualified women and
men, including persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and Aboriginal persons.

title: Customer Account Manager II, French Bilingual is a Plus!
description_9:
The purpose of the Customer Account Manager (CAM) is to meet and exceed assigned sales goals and objectives through add-on sales, upgrades to existing accounts, or migration to additional Sage products/services while delivering an extraordinary customer experience. These goals are achieved through the effective management of an assigned territory consisting of existing Sage customers and their associated channel partners. A consultative, value-based selling approach is utilized to increase the adoption and utilization of Sage solutions via add-ons, upgrades, cross-selling and connected services.

Key Responsibilities

Essential Functions:

* Revenue Generation

o Meet or exceed 100% of the assigned individual revenue quota.

* Territory Management

o Manage all aspects of an assigned territory based on existing Sage customers and their associated channel partners.

* Lead Generation and Qualification

o Proactively pursue all installed base leads which include direct mail, emails, user groups, inbound calls, welcome calls, trade shows and sales campaigns.

o Convert raw leads to qualified opportunities using a consultative, value-based selling approach.

o Develop customer and partner campaigns to generate additional sales leads.

* Direct Selling

o Align qualified opportunities with the associated channel partner or manage the sales process directly when applicable.

* Pipeline Management

o Utilize customer relationship management tools to track and maintain accurate records of all activities, target close dates, sales potential and close probabilities.

o Maintain an adequate pipeline to support monthly revenue goals.

o Regularly follow up on existing opportunities at the channel partner and customer level to increase close rates and decrease the sales cycle.

o Provide an accurate forecast of revenue on a weekly basis.

* Account Management

o Develop and maintain a strategic plan to proactively engage with assigned customers and channel partners on a consistent basis.

o Work with customers and channel partners to resolve open issues and escalate customer satisfaction issues to the appropriate internal or external resources where applicable.

* Partner Management

o Work with assigned channel partners to build and sustain an installed base business plan aligning channel partner and Sage revenue objective.

* Professional Selling Environment

o Achieve established revenue, productivity goals and performance objectives in a professional inside sales environment.

* Miscellaneous

o Manage additional projects, assignments and responsibilities as defined by the needs of the business.

* Protect company proprietary and confidential information

* Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

* Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent experience is preferred.

* 3+ years of business-to-business consultative sales experience achieving/overachieving an individual sales quota or equivalent experience is required.

* Must have excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize.

* Must be self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

* Experience in account management, channel sales or in the software/technology industry is a plus.

* A fundamental understanding of business process and operations is a plus.

* General computer skills and a working knowledge of Microsoft office products is required.

Physical Requirements:

* Generally exposed to normal office environment

* Ability to sit, walk, lift and carry up to 10 lbs

* Ability to communicate over the telephone â€“ hearing and speaking

* Ability to type on a keyboard and have finger/hand manipulation

French Bilingual is preferred for this role.

title: Manager/Director MGTM Customer Engagement
description_9:
Requisition ID: 159698
Work Area: Sales
Expected Travel: 0 - 60%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
As market leader in enterprise application software, SAP helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. From the back office to the boardroom, warehouse to storefront, on premise to cloud, desktop to mobile device â€“ SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively to stay ahead of the competition. SAP applications and services enable customers to operate profitably, adapt continuously, and grow sustainably.
SAP's Maintenance Go-To-Market (M-GTM) organization is enabling our customers to run better by maximizing the value and innovation from our solutions and support portfolio, while protecting and enhancing SAP's maintenance and support business.

Purpose and Objectives
In support of the M-GTM Customer Engagements strategy, a Manager/Director within the M-GTM team will be responsible for research, development, and delivery of Value of Support and Maintenance education to customers. The Manager/Director will work collaboratively with Maintenance Sales Directors within the M-GTM team to establish and deliver meaningful value propositions to customers, with the goal of enhancing a customer's consumption and perception of SAP innovations & services.

As a member of the M-GTM Customer Engagements Team, the Manager/Director role supports the following topics:

Customer Engagement and Education on Value of Support/Maintenance and Extension Policies
Alignment and Coordination with Americaâ€™s SAP User Group (ASUG) to drive education on value of Support and Maintenance to members
Alignment and Coordination with SAP colleagues in various organizations to develop, deliver, and drive education to customers on value of support and maintenance
Internal field sales enablement on M-GTM focus areas such as:
Value of Support and Maintenance
Extension Policies
Partner Education on Value of Support and Maintenance

Expectations and Tasks
Research and analysis on customer organization, support utilization, to define appropriate talk points/understand customer background
Clearly articulate value of utilizing Extension Policies to customers
Coordination with ASUG on events, education, webcasts, meetings to align appropriate presentations and resources
Coordination with internal colleagues to align on focus areas for value of support and maintenance topics to be shared with customers, partners, ASUG
Attend and present Value of Support and Maintenance in customer meetings (both on site and remote)
Education to partners on Value of Support and Maintenance through workshops
Internal enablement of field on M-GTM focus areas through events, meetings
Attend and present value of support and maintenance at Events/Chapter Meetings/Conferences
Regular reporting of status of tasks to management
Building out future roadmap on education of Value of Support and Maintenance
Follow up on individuals met at meetings/events/conferences and provide information to those who work with them (MSD, AE, ESA)
Capture and document attendees from various meetings/events/webinars
Capture, document, and follow up on any feedback received from various meetings/events/webinars
Quarterly proactive outreach to internal field to have touchpoint on any customers questioning value of support/maintenance
Follow up on any customers from these touchpoint meetings with regional MSD/ESA/AE

Work Experience
Team Oriented: demonstrates the comfort and ability to synergistically work with others to achieve a common goal without compromising one's own identity.
Support and/or Sales Background, or comparable skillset preferred
Marketing background an asset
Cross-topical experience and ability to connect different areas: Solutions/Products; Services & Support; Commercial aspects; Legal and CFR aspects; Contracts and licensing; etc.
Experience in culture and collaboration style within SAP, especially cross functions.
Strong ability of crisp communication, problem solving and network building within the company; a strong problem-solving attitude with the ability to find pragmatic ways to resolve a variety of topics.
The position requires you to be comfortable managing different tasks in parallel and act on multiple levels, from the overarching high level view to detailed oriented analysis

Location
North America, Canada or USA

title: Software Development Engineer
description_9:

Must be able to work closely with others to facilitate integration of new and existing systems and where necessary participate in a phased implementation of the new applications using standard development tools and methodologies. In addition to the ongoing responsibilities, this person should be able to participate in the research and implementation of development tools, methodology, standards, software distribution, configuration management, and release control mechanisms.
Major Duties & Responsibilities:
Develop and modify complex applications using programming tools. Document all code using standard forms and procedures, adhering to all naming conventions.
Perform analysis of customer and vendor requirements and create design specifications with time estimates for user interfaces, application enhancements, new functionality, and backend processes in collaboration with customers, Business Analysts, and other project team members. Provide 2 nd level support for issues escalated by our Client Support Desk.
Work with DBAs and other team members to ensure logical and physical data models and relationship diagrams are completed and executed according to a consistent methodology and user requirements. Perform or assist in the creation of back-end databases and work with DBAs to implement a turnover plan.
Tangible experience in performance testing, performance tuning, performance troubleshooting is required together with knowledge of supporting tooling
Proven track record of delivering results ensuring operational, reputational, and proprietary risks are minimized
Experience must include ability to identify and articulate problems, influence decision-making process as well as proven delivery of expected results
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to work in a fast paced environment
Highly developed critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
Promote and support an environment that encourages productivity, innovation, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism
Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with industry and/or business trends
Self-motivated team player with high energy and ability to work independently as well as within a team
Demonstrated experience in successfully managing complex organizational initiatives involving multiple functions and multiple business units/regions

title: Embedded Software Verification Engineer/Designer
description_9:
L3 WESCAM 
is an exciting company providing systems that capture stabilized, high-magnification images from fixed-wing, rotary-wing, UAV, aerostat and ground based platforms. From low-altitude tactical missions to long-range covert surveillance missions, images are transmitted in real-time to fixed and mobile receive locations for immediate interpretation. WESCAM's MX-Series of Electro-optic and Infrared (EO/IR), laser, surveillance and targeting systems provide unparalleled image stability and long-range detection capability to Defense/Military, Homeland Security, Search and Rescue and Airborne law enforcement agencies worldwide. Our dominance of the airborne platform space has positioned us for explosive and game changing growth into ground-based markets.
WESCAM offers a challenging and dynamic work environment. Work with leading-edge technology and tools, alongside some of the best thought leaders in our industry, in an environment that values work/life balance. Benefits include every second Friday off with pay (9/80 work schedule) in addition to regular vacation and public holidays, free on-site gym, free fruit, free bagels on the last day of the week, a strong focus on continuing education and much more. Most of all, WESCAM is working towards a noble cause. Our work has a direct link to saving people's lives and safeguarding freedom around the world. We truly do make a difference in our work and in the world!

For more information, please check us out at: http://www.WESCAM.com

To learn more about the History of WESCAM...

Under the guidance of senior software verification engineers/designers, you will have an active and accountable role in the verification and validation of software for world class, state-of-the-art, electro-optical surveillance systems. You will be responsible for reviewing software requirements and design elements, creating and maintaining requirements based software tests in an embedded environment, analyzing software defects uncovered through both dynamic and static testing, writing verification reports to document test results, and improving the overall software quality. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest software engineers and designers around, providing first class support to the rest of the organization.

title: Analyst, Vendor Attest
description_9:
LOCATION: Calgary, Alberta (CA-AB)
JOB NUMBER: 18266

Job Overview
Reporting to the team leader, vendor attest, you will provide financial insight to commercial agreements and vendor billing in order to maximize their value during execution. You will use your expertise to develop recommendations for our management teams to improve controls and efficiency.
Key Accountabilities
Perform attestation and assessments to commercial contracts to test risk and to determine if vendor audits are required
Analyze large amounts of data to identify problems and discrepancies and raise issues accordingly
Highlight specific control weaknesses and occurrences of contract non-compliance and provide independent recommendations for improvement in controls and processes
Support the overall planning, execution, and reporting of vendor contract compliance audits and controls assessments in accordance with professional standards and a risk-based approach
Manage our resources, tools, and technology to support the execution of audits while handling sensitive information and upholding confidentiality requirements
Balance a high volume of requests and execute work with a sense of urgency and strong attention to detail
Assist our team in executing and performing vendor audits when required
Build reports and present the audit, assessment, and attest results to our internal managers
Required Qualifications
Experience and Education:
Minimum two years of experience with the administration and compliance of contracts
Experience working in the oil and gas industry is preferred
High School Diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)
Skills and Knowledge:
Strong understanding of audit process and experience in its practical application
Strong software knowledge and adaptability with expertise in Microsoft Excel and SAP
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey difficult messages to a wide variety of audiences in a professional manner
You continually seek greater knowledge about the systems, processes and hazards in the workplace, to understand not just what you do but why you do it
You constantly ask what could go wrong and check for out-of-the-ordinary conditions and learn to anticipate potential problems
Working Conditions
This position is based in Calgary, Alberta at the Suncor Energy Centre with a Monday to Friday work schedule
Why Suncor
Go ahead. Expect growth. We want you to have a job you're genuinely excited about - as well as opportunities to learn and challenge yourself or mentor others. Plus, Suncor Energy offers a flexible employee package that can be adjusted to suit the changing needs of your life, including:
Competitive base salary and compensation programs

Our mission to create energy for a better world begins with caring about the communities we live and work in, while responding to your interests and concerns. Read our Suncor Connections newsletter to see how we're living up to our commitment to keeping you informed.
Business Overview
Suncor Energy is Canada's energy company - meaning rewarding opportunities for you to apply your knowledge, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Our business portfolio spans the entire energy sector, from a leadership position in oil sands development, to refining and marketing operations, natural gas, and conventional oil production, internationally and offshore East Coast Canada.
And while we are working to responsibly develop petroleum resources and contribute to the communities where we live and work, we are also developing our renewable energy portfolio, which includes wind power and biofuels.
As part of Suncor's team, you'll contribute to the ongoing success of Canada's largest energy company - one with a solid track record of growth, a focus on safety and sustainability and tremendous potential for the future. And you'll have the opportunity to learn from experts in the industry and build on your skills every day.

title: Web Developer
description_9:
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference and a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

Digital Solutions

is a new and exciting software development team at Manulife and is the foundation of Manulifeâ€™s digital transformation. We are striving to create leading, mobile and web experiences that enable

s

our customers to choose how, when and where they want to engage with their financial services. This is your opportunity to get in on the ground floor and help us re-imagine and reinvent what it means to deliver great software. You will join the Digital Solutions team as we build our new

Digital Garage

where teams are working together to shape what it means to have a great customer experience and build awesome solutions that will delight all Canadians. Our Garage promotes collaboration across our agile teams with the use of modern tools, platforms, and services.

In support of this vision, we are growing our team

s

and looking for enthusiastic and inspired people who want to be a part of our future.
As the Full stack developer, you will:
Develop scalable and maintainable web applications. Products may include user interfaces, integrations with web services using React, Node.js, Salesforce

Work closely with Solution lead to drive innovative solutions to meet business needs

Participate in an agile delivery model in partnership with various product enablement teams

Collaborate with software engineers and engineering leadership to uncover pain points and opportunities to accelerate the delivery of new business value through platforms and software

Assume the roles of senior developer and expert to more junior members of the team

Proven experience developing for projects in a complex business and marketing environment

Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems

Last year Manulife / John Hancock spent $1.4 billion on technology. You will be working with:

Technologies/Languages such as Salesforce, React, NodeJS, ISAM and/or similar technologies

Cloud Foundry and other components supporting a highly-automated global engineering platform

Open source! As we accelerate our delivery of world-class experiences, we know embracing open source technologies will help us get there. Any experience with open source is very attractive to us!

Qualifications

You will bring and continuously build upon the following skills:

An entrepreneurial spirit and comfort working within a rapidly changing startup environment; you love the challenge of working on a small team and being part of a larger movement to change the engineering culture of an enterprise

Familiarity with agile and DevOps principles, test-driven development, continuous integration, and other Software Engineering best practices to accelerate the delivery and quality of new features

Eagerness to learn emerging technologies and understanding how they will impact what comes next

A capacity for constant learning from both success and failure, remaining open to change and continuous improvement

Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through the creative process

Strong verbal and written communication with the ability to effectively articulate and communicate technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes to engineering leadership

5 or more yearsâ€™ experience working in or leading complex enterprise implementations

Want to learn more? Apply today, we are eager to speak with you!

About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. As of June 30, 2017, we had over $1 trillion (US$780 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $26.7 billion in payments to our customers.

Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

title: Production Application Support Analyst
description_9:
We reward our people with a competitive compensation and benefits package and a fun, flexible working environment.
We currently have several permanent full-time opportunities
for a:
Systems Analyst â€“ Production Application Support
Highlights:

When a bystander walks past your computer do they ask you if you're looking at the Matrix? Have you ever made a Developer or QA team member cry tears of happiness and gratitude? Do people throughout the organization come to you because you get the job done? Have you ever tamed a wild RDBMS? Are you a high functioningindividual in stressful situations? Are you obsessed with keeping the data on time and system up and running?
If you've answered yes to any of these questions, we want to talk to you!

We're looking for the rare talent that can provide a blend of L3 application support, system engineering/analyst capabilities, technology stack support (all the way from the hardware to the UI) and who understands the aims of DevOps as it relates to culture, automation, measurement/monitoring and

sharing.
Overall Responsibility:

Soliumâ€™s production support team is responsible for supporting our internal and customer-facing web application in order to fulfill our required service standards. The team interacts with multiple business teams within Solium including software developers, customer support, operations, and quality assurance and provides hands-on technical assistance as needed. The team is dedicated to ensuring a quick response to urgent customer needs and special requests as they arise.

At this time the Production Application Support Team is undergoing a transformation into a service driven arm of the organization with the following aims:

Keeping the data on time:
SQL and Scripting are our main tools to make sure the data is correct and the equity is managed the way our customers need. We use Oracle and in addition to SQL skills the ability to administer Oracle is preferred.
Keeping the system and all its components operational:
Shareworks makes Equity Management easy for our clients. That means it's on us to keep it running and bring the creations of our developers to life. It's a complex system and working on it is both interesting and exciting. Software systems knowledge combined with strong debugging skills are required.

Monitoring and measurement:
Knowing how the system is doing over time and how things are trending. We simply have to know what is going on in the system. We use a series of metrics to drive a dedicated process of ongoing improvement. We are not complacent and are always looking for ways to make our system better. Step one is measuring everything. Step two is understanding the story our data is telling us.
Automation and Tooling:
We're not keen on repetitive tasks and seek to apply automation where it makes sense.
Skills that we require:

We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. Experience working in a cross-discipline team is a plus and candidates who can demonstrate an ability to iterate rapidly on design ideas, take feedback and act on it quickly will be at an advantage.

title: Implementation Specialist
description_9:
Job Description: Implementation Specialist, Associate ( REMOTE- Based)

This position reports to the Client Services Manager as a member of the Services Team providing dedicated training and implementation services and support to our clients.

Primary Responsibilities

Function in the role of Implementation Specialist in conjunction with the Client Services Manager and other team members on new customer/new license installations. Liaison with Client Services Manager and the client for the duration of the implementation process. Work collaboratively with the Project Managers and team resources on product set up.

Develop product area expertise in product areas (Finance, HR, Payroll)

Travel to client sites, train and implement atrieveERP software; including business analysis, pre-implementation planning, pre-training and support. Upon completion of services, prepare and document services/installation project outcome.

Delivers customer-requested training or consulting sessions on software modules- (remote or on-site). Prepare and document business specifications and project outcome.

Conduct on-site or remote Business Application Audit Services and Training for customers. Prepare assessment audit report with recommendations.

Deliver on service opportunities as assigned. Work with Client Services Manager to coordinate and schedule application installation and training activities (remote or on-site).

Promote additional add-on products and services to clients. Seek service opportunities.

Configure and participate in product demonstrations. Write, edit and maintain training documentation. Documentation may include, but is not limited to: product manuals, release notes, client communication, setup guides, FAQâ€™s, training videos and training materials.

Conduct internal product quality control testing when required.

Conduct internal product, support, and service orientation and training for new atrieveERP personnel.

Attend Userâ€™s Group conference if required; prepare and deliver presentations as assigned.

Complete timesheets; ensure proper entry and allocation of time to ensure accurate time entry reporting and billing to clients.

Requirement to work on special projects as needed.

Responsible for supporting Research & Development initiatives.

Other related duties as assigned.

Secondary Responsibilities

Act as escalation point and consultant for the Support Team and Product Development Team.

Work as Software Support Analyst, responding to application and problem management support calls from clients. Carry out detailed problem definition, analysis and research to identify the source and nature of the problem; replicate/analyze client issues; provide resolutions or recommendations for each call.

Provide internal training to Support and Service Team members.

Produce and conduct webinars for the client community.

Produce content for the eNews.
Skills Preferred:
Previous experience in software support and software implementations

An understanding of the K-12 market

An understanding of ERP modules (Finance, HR, Payroll)

Project management experience

Highly motivated and client-oriented.

Excellent spoken and written English.

Excellent communication and training skills (oral, written and group presentation skills).

Strong problem solving and analytical skills; Ability to work calmly under pressure

Leadership skills and the confidence to direct clients

Ability to multi-task and prioritize; Proven record of completing projects

Strong team player with positive attitude.

Outstanding interpersonal skills.

Results and detail oriented. Superior diagnostic, troubleshooting, service skills.

Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with a high degree of energy and competitiveness.

Strong attention to accuracy and detail.

Enthusiasm for operating in a busy work environment.

Professional manner, balanced with ethical behavior and judgment.

title: Administrative Support (AS4) Athabasca/Westlock
description_9:
Are you a highly motivated and organized individual seeking an opportunity to use your administrative support experience? Join an excellent team and contribute to the effective functioning of our Athabasca and Westlock offices. North Central Region is looking to fill the role of Administrative Assistant. Reporting to the Administrative Team Lead (ATL), you will be responsible for the administrative support of essential Child Intervention programs that include, but are not limited to: Core Protection, Family Enhancement, Foster Care and Adoptions. It is essential that you gain a thorough understanding of the programs you support and will be required to perform duties related to each program that could include computer entry, data processing, information entry in a timely manner, word processing of reports and letters as requested, financial processing and tracking, filing on a weekly basis, responding to client inquiries and other administrative support duties as required for the office. Experience working with Microsoft Office programs is essential as you will need to apply your skills in computer programs, accounting, and word processing. Strong communication, interpersonal, organization and time management skills will be required in your daily duties to be effective in this role.

Qualifications

High school diploma and two years related experience. Post-secondary education in Office Administration would be an asset.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office software is required. Knowledge of Alberta Government Integrated Management Information System (IMAGIS) and ExClaim is an asset. Equivalencies will be considered.

Salary

$1,691.44 - $2,066.65 bi-weekly

Notes

This position will be supporting both our Westlock and Athabasca offices and can be located in either location.

The successful candidate will require a valid Alberta Driver's license and have access to a reliable vehicle as some travel may be required. Final candidates for this position will be asked to undergo an Intervention Services Record Check and provide a Criminal Record Check. This competition may be used to fill current and future vacancies across North Central Alberta.

How to Apply

Online applications are preferred on www.jobs.alberta.ca

Applicants who apply online will be able to track the status of this competition. Please ensure that you include contact information including email address on resume. The title of your document must be 20 characters or shorter.

Note: As only one file can be uploaded, please ensure your cover letter, resume and any other related documents are submitted in one file saved with a title of 20 characters or less.

Should you require more information please call 780-324-3202.

For individuals who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada, it is recommended that you obtain an evaluation of your credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS) and include the IQAS assessment certificate as part of your application. Further information on IQAS is available at: http://work.alberta.ca/Immigration/international-qualifications-assessment-service.html

Closing Statement

We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' education and experience best meet the needs of the position. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Clinical Research Software Development Specialist, Clinical Research Unit
description_9:
The Clinical Research Unit in the Cumming School of Medicine invites applications for a Clinical Research Software Development Specialist . This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 1 year (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension.
The Clinical Research Unit in the Cumming School of Medicine at the University of Calgary provides research and analytical data support services to faculty researchers and their collaborators.
This position reports to the Manager, Data Services in the Clinical Research Unit.
This position is to support the development of a custom web-based injury surveillance platform for the Sport Injury Prevention Research Centre and Integrated Concussion Research Program at the University of Calgary. In addition, this individual will develop and manage process for the timely delivery of CRU solutions, provide input and feedback to team members, plan and track project deliveries, as well as develop and architect solutions. There will be peak periods during the year that are stressful due to overlapping deadlines and shifting priorities.

Must stay abreast of the latest technologies, best in industry standards, and solutions

Use problem-solving skills to work through issues quickly and come up with advice, counsel, messages and approaches to coordinate an issue.

Identify opportunities for innovation and how these can be applied to add business value

Delivery/Support

title: Biostatistician, Clinical Research Unit
description_9:
The Clinical Research Unit at the Tom Baker Cancer Centre is recruiting a Senior Biostatistician. This position provides advanced biostatistical expertise to the researchers, research projects and quality improvement projects in the Department of Oncology at the Tom Baker Cancer Centre and also leads independent research of new scientific methodologies. The senior biostatistician will use his/her knowledge of statistics to collaborate with researchers in the design of clinical trials, develop guidelinesIparameters for data gathering and conduct and oversee the analysis and interpretation of statistical data arising from scientific/cancer research.
Description:
Responsibilities include: Performs and leads advanced statistical analyses of data housed within the relevant primary and administrative datasets, often involving large, complex datasets and linkage of multiple data sources within AHS. This analysis will require advanced knowledge of statistical techniques and the development of novel statistical methods. Provides supervision and mentorship to analysts, fellows and graduate students working on department-related projects Completion of the statistical requirements of clinical trials from the design stage through the analytical, presentation and publication stages. Provides statistical consultation to and instructs researchers, assistants and students in the methods of statistical analysis and computing Teaches and presents on statistical methods to a variety of audiences Provides expertise on the input of data into systems to ensure data is usable in statistical analyses, generating reports and in tracking quality indicators. As a co-investigator or collaborator in grants, reviews and writes sections of the grant proposal in collaboration with multiple stakeholders. Provides expertise on the framing of research questions, determining outcomes and how they are measured. Determines appropriate methods of statistical analyses based on in-depth knowledge, discussions with collaborators, and by reviewing the current literature. Provides in-depth expertise and advisory support to stakeholders, professional staff and senior leaders on study design, implementation and execution of biostatistical models Leads and investigates independent and collaborative multidisciplinary research within area of expertise, contributing to development of new scientific methodologies and published literature by identifying gaps in existing methods for improvement opportunities.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer, WorldGaming (6-month contract)
description_9:
Cineplex is one of Canada's leading entertainment companies and operates numerous businesses including theatrical exhibition, food service, amusement gaming (Player One Amusement Group), alternative programming (Cineplex Events), traditional and digital media (Cineplex Media and Cineplex Digital Media), out of home leisure and entertainment (The Rec Room), eSports (WorldGaming), and home entertainment content (CineplexStore.com). Cineplex is also a joint venture partner in SCENE - Canada's largest entertainment loyalty program.
We are proudly a Canadian company with approximately 13,000 employees in Canada and the US, and we offer competitive compensation. To learn more about Cineplex please visit our website at www.cineplex.com.
WorldGaming, a division of Cineplex Entertainment, is a leading gaming platform that facilitates tournaments, leagues and gaming ladders for thecompetitive gaming community both online and in live venues.WorldGaming currently has an opening for the position of Full Stack Software Engineer , reporting to the Executive Director, Product and Development, WorldGaming. PLEASE NOTE: This is a 6-month contract opportunity.
THE JOB:WorldGaming offers you the best of both work worlds: a small company with a start-up culture plus all the benefits of a large corporation with a great reputation.
As a Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be wearing many hats. All members of the development team are expected to be familiar with all parts of the stack, to contribute to project planning and scoping, to be part of architecture discussions and to perform maintenance on production systems as necessary.
Here is what we are using right now, every day: Elixir, node.js, AngularJS, Java, SpringBoot.
We are an agile shop, but we are not 100% by-the-manifesto agile, as we only adopt processes that actually help us.
Our growing micro service ecosystem means many interesting projects. You will not be stuck on one project for months. Our developers typically work on a few different projects every week, and sometimes every day.
In all of our work, reliability, security and consistency are our core goals, and we are passionate about tests.
We value collaboration, learning and teaching. We also value the individual, and support a healthy work-life balance.
RESPONSIBILITIES:As a Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be expected to: Implement innovative designs that support WorldGaming's business goals Work collaboratively with product stake holders to clarify and improve project requirements Collaborate with the Technology team to work in all layers of the system including UI, backend services, devices, and automated testing EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: A BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or other related technical disciplines 1 to 4 years of software development experience Experience designing and implementing applications Experience with technologies including or similar to: Elixir, node.js, AngularJS, Java, SpringBoot Experience with relational databases and SQL Experience using a TDD or BDD approach Experience with agile or scrum development environments Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with other departments Problem solving and time management skills Interested applicants please apply today. Interested applicants please apply today.
While we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. As part of Cineplex Entertainment's standard recruitment process, suitable candidate(s) will be required to undergo pre-employment screening as a condition of employment or promotion.
No Agency Calls Please

Health and Wellness (HW) provides counselling to students with a wide range of concerns ranging from relationship problems to debilitating depression and anxiety, suicidal and/or homicidal ideation, post-traumatic stress, and eating disorders.

The Wellness Counselor and Coordinator is a Registered Social Worker and is an integral member of the embedded mental health care team in HW. As a member of the embedded mental health care team, and under the direction of the Director, Professional Practice & Quality Assurance, provides life coaching, personal counselling and solution/ goal focused psychotherapy to students at the University in accordance with the University of Toronto Health and Wellness, vision, mission, and strategic plan, and is expected to demonstrate quality and effectiveness in work habits. In addition to personal counselling the incumbent will act as a consultant to faculty, staff, and students on counseling and related matters, conducts workshops and relevant training. Inherent in this role are the knowledge, skills and attitudes specific to critical thinking and decision making, ability to analyze and assess presenting mental health concerns and collaborate with the medical team in the management of these mental health concerns, and flexibility and decision making in fluid situations with unpredictable outcomes.
Duties include: conducting screening/intake assessments; facilitating discharge planning; developing and facilitating community referrals and referring to the university or outside community; providing brief counselling to individuals; and running psycho-educational workshops.

Qualifications

:
(MINIMUM)
Education:
MSW and is a member in good standing with the Ontario College of Social Workers and Social Service Workers.
Experience:
Minimum five (5) years related experience. Related experience should be in a Community Mental Health Setting, and/or Outpatient Mental Health Unit where the incumbent has performed client intakes/assessments, crisis counselling, brief or short-term counselling to individuals, and psycho-educational workshops. Life coaching, mindful based therapies and alternative evidenced based therapies considered an asset. Extensive experience with mental health and illness, behavioural issues, anger management, and conflict resolution. Skill in working with university-aged young adults, and individuals in crisis an asset.
Skills:
Keyboarding skills and working knowledge of relevant software is required (e.g. Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint); Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Other:
Good judgment and sensitivity, flexibility and resourcefulness. Experience working with post-secondary students and knowledge of university and community mental health resources is an asset. Ability to communicate effectively with staff and senior academic administrators about issues facing students in crisis and make recommendations. Able to exercise patience, tact, judgment and discretion. Demonstrated ability to relate to students, staff, and faculty in ways that build confidence and trust. Able to work in a highly diverse community with students from varied backgrounds and a variety of age groups, presenting with a range of difficulties and personal issues.
Travel: None

Software Developer
ArcelorMittal Dofasco
Permanent Position

ArcelorMittal Dofasco operates a world class computer integrated manufacturing facility in Hamilton, utilizing state of the art information technologies. The Process Automation Department is responsible for large scale, high impact computer software application systems that are integral to manufacturing processes, from raw material processing to finished products.

Position Description

We are seeking a full-time employee with an educational background in Computer Science or Software Engineering, to work as part of high-performing teams that support and improve manufacturing related software application systems. These systems are implemented using object-oriented software, inter-system messaging, and relational database technologies. These systems are essential to the operation of our industry-leading manufacturing processes and are part of one of the largest integrated IT environments in Canada. Our personnel have opportunities to work across many IT technologies within a continuous improvement culture. As personnel capabilities expand over time, responsibilities widen and the opportunity for advancement grows.

The job includes some or all the following continuous improvement subject areas:

Real-time product tracking

Business System integration

Manufacturing Operator interfaces

Business Intelligence systems

Manufacturing process models and automatic process control

University Bachelor or Masters degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering

Software architecture, design, development, modification, testing, deployment & validation

Object-oriented programming using C++, C# or Java

C programming

SQL and related Oracle/SQL Server software tools
Knowledge of software development life cycle: analysis, design, implementation, testing, commissioning, validation & documentation

Problem investigation, analysis and solving

Technical learning and knowledge development

Teamwork and collaboration

Initiative and drive

0 â€“ 5 years professional experience

Work Environment

Office

Highly collaborative

Many training opportunities

Free parking

Company performance bonuses

Work Expectations

Flexibility to determine work day start and end times, to fit personal needs

Corporate Background

ArcelorMittal Dofasco plays a key role in North Americaâ€™s advanced manufacturing supply chain working with the top automotive, energy, packaging and construction brands to develop lighter, stronger and more sustainable products â€“ from cans to cars.

Founded in 1912, we are Hamiltonâ€™s largest private sector employer with more than 5,000 employees shipping 4.5 million net tons of high quality flat carbon steel annually. Around the world, the ArcelorMittal Group employs 240,000 employees in 60 countries and looks to flagship sites like ArcelorMittal Dofasco to develop new technology and products that are fundamentally transforming tomorrow.

ArcelorMittal Dofascoâ€™s iconic motto Our Product is Steel. Our Strength is People. Â® Is a true expression of our belief that people are the companyâ€™s competitive advantage. Underpinning this are our values of Quality, Sustainability and Leadership â€“ brought to life by generations of employees who have come to work for more than 100 years creating world class products, processes and services.

Corporate responsibility is paramount to our operations and our commitment spans four pillars: investing in people, enriching our community, making steel sustainable and transparent governance.

Dofasco supports both personal and family health and well-being. In addition to on-site gyms Dofasco employees have access to a unique 750-acre recreation park that features community activities, sports events as well as multiple on-site fitness facilities with state-of-the-art equipment.

Interested and qualified applicants should submit their resume directly to dofasco.arcelormittal.com . The applicant must be legally eligible to work permanently in Canada.

ArcelorMittal Dofasco is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply.

title: Maintenance Technician
description_9:
About Us:

GE Renewable Energy is a 9 billion dollar start-up that brings together one of the broadest product and service portfolios of the renewable energy industry. With 13,000 employees present in more than 40 countries, and headquartered in Paris, GE Renewable Energy is backed-up by the resources of the worldâ€™s first digital industrial company. We take the earthâ€™s most abundant resources - the strength of the wind, the force of water, and the heat of the sun, - and put them to work with breakthrough technology that unleashes their true possibilities. Combining onshore and offshore wind, hydro and innovative technologies such as concentrated solar power, GE Renewable Energy has installed more than 370 gigawatts capacity globally to make the world work better and cleaner.
Role Summary:
Based at Dufferin site, Melancthon, Ontario with travelling up to 50% of year across Ontario and 25% of the year in Alberta and USA.
Essential Responsibilities:
Perform planned maintenances and operations of GE wind turbine generators (WTG).
Keeping strong adherence to General Electricâ€™s EHS policy during maintenance scope.
Evaluate maintenance program to reduce scope and increase mean time between scopes.

Operate GE turbines and turbine interrogation systems.

Troubleshoot, and repair failures, which may occur, and collect data.
Conduct electronic troubleshooting using wire and block diagram schematics when needed during maintenance scope.
Maintain all computer-generated service records and time sheets using Oracle software.
Take responsibility through coordination with manager to ensure necessary tools for maintenance are available when needed.
Conduct Lock-out-Tag-out on mechanical, hydraulic and/or electrical systems.

Technical diploma in a discipline from an accredited institution.
At least 2 yearsâ€™ experience in an electrical/mechanical service industry, commercial or residential, preferably in power generation.
Desired Characteristics:
Wind turbine or rotating equipment maintenance experience.

Strong EHS skills and awareness.

You MUST possess a valid driverâ€™s license.
You MUST possess an acceptable driving record.
You MUST have no barriers to eligibility for United States work visa.
You MUST possess the ability to climb steel towers up to 360 feet.
You MUST submit your application for employment through gecareers.com to be considered.
You MUST be 18 years or older.
You MUST be willing to submit to a background investigation and fit test as part of the selection process.
Locations: Canada; Ontario; Shelburne, Orangeville

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . title: Software Developer, University Graduate
description_9:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions. Product and Systems Development
Whether it's finding new and innovative ways to advance search quality, building computing platform and networking technologies, automating the indexing of videos, or continuing to refine and scale complex auction systems (just to name a few), you will be developing solutions to some of the most challenging technical problems out there. You will research, conceive and develop software applications to extend and improve on Google's product offerings and collaborate on scalability issues involving access to massive amounts of data and information. Examples of specialist domains: UI development with AJAX and similar technologies, security, embedded systems and mobile apps (Android), developer tools (IDEs, large-scale build systems, compilers). Engineering Productivity
As a software engineer in the Engineering Productivity organization, you'll use your software design, analysis and programming skills to create innovative automated test systems. This isn't a job in which you'll simply debug and run test cases, in fact that only scratches the surface. The test team undertakes a broad range of challenges on a daily basis, designing and building intelligent systems that can explore various use cases and scenarios for distributed computing infrastructure. Just imagine trying to design and build an automated testing system for something that's never been done before. There are no text books that can help you learn this, which is why we have some of the best engineers working in this group. Site Reliability
Software engineers working in Site Reliability are involved in every facet of Google's production and work on the cutting edge of cloud- based computing. As a member of this elite team you are in the thick of everything involved with keeping Google running, from code-level troubleshooting of traffic anomalies to maintenance of our most cutting edge services; from monitoring and alerts to building new automation infrastructure. Software engineers on this team love to create robust and scalable software that scale to tens of millions of users. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day, and work with just about every other engineering and operations team to provide services and applications that are quintessentially Google -- fast, reliable and accessible to all.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

title: Document Clerk
description_9:
Document Clerk

Are you looking for a career with a company that integrates state of the art hardware, software, and consulting and support service? Ricoh Canada Inc. is a leading provider of document solutions. Ricoh's fully integrated hardware and software products help businesses share information efficiently and effectively by enabling customers to control the input, management and output of documents.
To help you thrive, Ricoh provides an award-winning training program, an excellent support structure, and a comprehensive benefits package. Ricoh values their employees and want their employees to succeed with their career goals; Ricoh assists with career development by promoting from within the organization and assisting with continuing education!
Ricoh is currently looking for a career-oriented individual to manage a high volume mail room and copy centre. In this position, the selected candidate will be responsible for managing, operating and overseeing a fleet of office equipment; including copiers, printers, scanners, faxes and multi-function devices. In addition, the primary focus is building relationships with customers while providing important office support.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Sorting and distribution of mail and office supplies, including interoffice, couriers and overnight mail
Delivery of mail and printing projects throughout the customers site
Coordinating and preparing projects for printing, including electronic file conversion, document scanning and enhancement from start to delivery
Download jobs from email or print queue, sizing, reproducing, sorting and finishing
Establishing and maintaining quality controls to ensure work accuracy
Responding to first level phone calls from end users of equipment to determine the problem, clear paper jams, run test copies and determine status of machines
Provide scheduled trips to all machines to conduct cleaning of glass, toner replacement, stocking paper and general cleanness of work space
Running reports
Keeping logs of downtime, repairs and meter charges of all copiers/printers on site
QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION:
High School Diploma or equivalent work experience
EXPERIENCE:
Minimum 2 years of experience working in a mail room or copy centre
SKILLS:
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to quickly develop business relationships
Strong self-motivation to drive results
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
Effective use of Microsoft Office
Ability to lift 30+lbs. as necessary
OTHER
Present a professional image at all times to customers and vendors
About Ricoh Canada
Ricoh Canada Inc. is a leading provider of document solutions. Ricoh's fully integrated hardware and software products help businesses share information efficiently and effectively by enabling customers to control the input, management and output of documents. Ricoh Canada Inc. is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ricoh America's Corporation with its head office located in Toronto, employing over 2,100 employees nation-wide.
Ricoh is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer -- M/F/Disability/Veteran

title: Sales Manager, Edmonton AB
description_9:
The Peak Group of Companies is a North American leader in home improvement and among the fastest growing firms in our industry. We are a diversified group, supplying a vast array of innovative products throughout Canada and the United States as well as operating Canadaâ€™s largest B2B and B2C home installationsâ€™ company.
Peak is a strategic partner of Home Depot, the worldâ€™s largest home improvement retailer. Through the power of our partnership with Home Depot, Peak Installations is now Canadaâ€™s largest B2B and B2C exterior home renovations company. Each year we help thousands of home owners renovate, beautify and add value to their homes.
We are experiencing exponential growth and we are looking for an experienced and self-motivated leader to join our team as a Sales Manager in the Edmonton Region.
This is what our Sales Managers say about this role:
â€œI enjoy the responsibility of managing the territory and working closely with the Home Depot colleaguesâ€
â€œDelivering best in class customer service helps me to reach my sales targetsâ€.
â€œProviding targeted coaching to the sales consultants that helps them hit the desired income is what I like about my jobâ€.
Accountabilities:
Home Depot Customer
Ensure exceptional customer service is delivered by the sales team. Manage customer service effectively by responding to escalated customer inquiries/concerns related to sales portion of the customer journey and leveraging relationships with Installation partners.
Work collaboratively with the project coordination and installations teams to ensure worry-free customer journey.
Sales
Achieve sales targets for an assigned territory by monitoring reports and analyzing business metrics such as closing ratio, sales targets, and customer feedback. Building on strengths, and proactively address risks and issues.
Consistently monitor reports to ensure the sales leads from the Home Depot stores are managed effectively.
Leadership
Lead a team of commissioned sales consultants. The consultants visit the homes of Home Depot customers and successfully close the sales of roofing, window, door installation services and other exterior renovation programs.
Select, train, and provide support to the sales consultants to make sure they are positioned success in achieving sales targets
Ensure that the sales consultants are well informed of current product offerings and installation methods.
Connectivity with Home Depot
Develop strong connectivity with the Home Depot stores by building and nurturing relationships with store management and associates, providing timely updates and training on the exterior renovation service offerings.
Sales Manager Profile:
Business degree
Proven track record leading a team of commissioned sales team and achieving ambitious sales targets
Knowledge of windows, doors, roofing and siding products as well as installation methods an asset
Strong leadership, management and coaching skills
3-5 years of professional in-home sales experience an asset
Proficiency with MS Office and CRM software
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Detail-oriented, well organized, and a proven ability to multi-task
Ability to spend 80% of your time travelling your market with the sales team
The Peak Group of Companies is a.n equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.
If interested, please forward a copy of your cover letter and rÃ©sumÃ© in confidence to us.

title: Lab Technician, Concrete & Cement
description_9:
Why work for Lafarge?
Lafarge
in Canada is proud to provide construction solutions in the buildings, infrastructure and industrial segments. These solutions are built with high performance products from our cement, aggregates, ready-mix concrete, asphalt and road construction, and concrete products divisions. From the use of alternative materials and recycling to renewable energy, Lafarge's focus is to develop innovative products that can contribute toward
sustainably
constructed building solutions. Lafarge takes
personal growth and development
to heart, and provides resources for our employees to take control of their own careers. Through our commitment to communities, to the health and safety of our employees and their families, or through the many volunteer hours of our employees, Lafarge demonstrates our care for people. If you want to work in an environment that values hard work, entrepreneurship, and collaborative teamwork, Lafarge is for you.
Building Better Cities
is what we do. Come
Build a Better Career
with us! More information can be found at
www.lafarge-na.com/careers
.
Overview
As
part of the WCAN Technical Centre team the Lab Technician focuses on concrete, aggregate and cement testing. Reporting to the Lab Manager, the Lab Technician monitors and maintains the quality assurance for all products and quality systems in place at the Lafarge. This team supports internal and external Lafarge customers though New Product Development (NPD), innovative customer solutions and customer support.
In cooperation with the internal staff and management, this position ensures product quality through effective and responsible execution of the quality assurance policies and procedures. The Lab Technician establishes and maintains quality procedures meeting CSA and Lafarge Internal Quality Standards.

title: Network Specialist
description_9:
Powered by state-of-the-art fibre optic and wireless networks, Eastlink delivers world-class video entertainment and communications services to residential, business and public sector customers across Canada. As one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies for 11 consecutive years, Eastlink provides high speed Internet, wireless, TV, telephone, security and automation, data communications and exclusive, locally-produced programming. Headquartered in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Eastlink is the largest privately owned telecommunications Company in Canada with an employee base of just over 1500 individuals.

Reporting to the Manager, Core Network Telephones, the Network Specialist will be part of a team responsible for the Operation, Administration, Maintenance and Provisioning of Eastlinkâ€™s telephone network. The incumbent will be responsible for performing end to end support of hardware and software on our core telephone services. The incumbent will work with various departments on special projects including the installation of new components in the telephone network to grow value added services for Eastlinkâ€™s customer base within Canada.

The ideal candidate is a professional, customer orientated individual who has above average problem solving skills and technical aptitude. A self motivated team player, the ideal candidate liaises with key stakeholders with ease and thrives in a dynamic, deadline driven work environment.
Job Responsibilities:

title: Executive Secretary
description_9:
Reporting directly to the Vice President & Chief Human Resources Officer (VP & CHRO), with a functional reporting structure to the Manager, HR Strategy, Integration and Analytics, this position supports the strategic leadership of the HR portfolio and is accountable for the efficient coordination and operation of a comprehensive range of human resources programs and services. The Executive Assistant will also provide administrative and special project support to other HR leadership members in the Office of the VP & CHRO. As the first point of contact for these offices, this incumbent excels at client relations, communication, office administration, and maintains a professional level of service and tact at all times. The ability to prioritize requests and ensure services are carried out in a manner consistent with Covenant Healthâ€™s Mission, Vision, Values and Ethical Guidelines are key to this position.
Description:
Support the HR portfolio leadership in building on the tradition, values and strategic directions of Covenant Health to advance the People and Culture Strategy through realization of a workplace where team members can thrive in their calling to serve; Be knowledgeable of and supports the effective delivery of operational human resource support services to HR leadership and staff, including engagement, wellness, organizational and staff development, salary administration, recruitment and retention, labour/employee relations, job evaluation and design, workforce planning strategies, performance management, policies and procedures, and employee benefits administration, Staff Education, and Occupational Health & Safety services; Collate budget asks, prepares and tracks operating budget submissions; Ensure appropriate human resources support is being provided to Executive and Senior Leadership Team members; refer onward as necessary and appropriate; Develop and maintain a positive working relationship with both internal and external representatives through professional and timely communication; Establish and maintain a valued network with human resource practitioners in allied agencies, in particular Alberta Health Services; Maintain a current awareness of leading human resource practices and HR implications of healthcare reform initiatives; Model the way in creating a culture that encourages superior customer service and a high level of team engagement.
